viewpoints.name: R2 - Requirement Catalogue
viewpoints.notes: The R2 represents a catalog of requirements in the architectural model. For this purpose, categories can be created in which the functional and non-functional requirements can be grouped.

viewpoints.name: R3 - Requirement Dependencies
viewpoints.notes: The R3 is used to show dependencies between different requirements.

viewpoints.name: R7 - Requirement Derivation
viewpoints.notes: The R7 assigns functional and non-functional requirements to the demanding architectural elements. In addition, information about the planned realization can be shown.

viewpoints.name: R8 - Requirement Fulfilment
viewpoints.notes: The R8 is used to determine and map acceptance and evaluation criteria for the individual functional and non-functional requirements.

viewpoints.name: Rr - Requirement Realization
viewpoints.notes: In the Rr, requirements are assigned to the realizing architectural elements.

FunctionalRequirement.notes: The element represents a functional requirement (what should the system / software be able to do?).

NonfunctionalRequirement.notes: The element represents a non-functional requirement (how should the system / software be able to do something?).

RequirementCatalogue.notes: Element represents a catalog of requirements, which consists of different categories (RequirementCategory) of functional and non-functional requirements.

RequirementCategory.notes: Element represents a category of a catalog of requirements.

Standard.notes: A ratified and peer-reviewed specification that is used to guide or constrain the architecture. A Standard may be applied to any element in the architecture.

Finding.notes: An ascertainment made in the model, which relates to the methodology used, the subject under consideration, the tool or something else.

Recommendation.notes: Need for action from a finding.

ActualOrganization.notes: An actual formal or informal organizational unit, e.g. "Driving and Vehicle Licensing Agency", "UAF team Alpha".

ActualPost.notes: An actual, specific post, an instance of a Post "type" - e.g., "President of the United States of America." where the Post would be president.

ActualProject.notes: A time-limited endeavor to provide a specific set of ActualResource that meet specific Capability needs.

Concern.notes: Interest in an EnterprisePhase (EnterprisePhase is synonym for System in ISO 42010) relevant to one or more of its stakeholders.

Organization.notes: A group of OrganizationalResources (Persons, Posts, Organizations and Responsibilities) associated for a particular purpose.

Person.notes: A type of a human being used to define the characteristics that need to be described for ActualPersons (e.g. properties such as address, telephone number, nationality, etc).

Post.notes: A type of job title or position that a person can fill (e.g. Lawyer, Solution Architect, Machine Operator or Chief Executive Officer).

Project.notes: A type that describes types of time-limited endeavours that are required to meet one or more Capability needs.

tagged_values.name: Used templates and specifications for SIR
Used templates and specifications for SSO

DocumentReference.notes: The element describes a regulation, instruction or a general document.

OperationalConstraint.notes: A Rule governing a logical architectural element i.e. OperationalPerformer, OperationalActivity, InformationElement etc.

tagged_values.name: Id
tagged_values.description: Lesbare laufende Nummerierung für den Forderungskatalog

tagged_values.name: Uuid
tagged_values.description: Maschinenlesbare Nummerierung für das Requirements Management Tool

Reference.notes: Element describes all types of references.

ResourceConstraint.notes: A rule governing the structural or functional aspects of an implementation.

ServicePolicy.notes: A constraint governing the use of one or more ServiceSpecifications.

SMEReference.notes: Element stands for a result of a workshop or expert knowledge.

FitCriterion.notes: This element represents an acceptance criterion for a functional or non-functional requirement.

FulfilmentCriterion.notes: This element represents a criterion for evaluating the degree of implementation of a functional or non-functional requirement.

ServiceFunction.notes: An Activity that describes the abstract behavior of ServiceSpecifications, regardless of the actual implementation.

ServiceInterface.notes: A contract that defines the ServiceMethods and ServiceMessageHandlers that the ServiceSpecification realizes.

ServiceSpecification.notes: The specification of a set of functionality provided one element for the use of others.

ServiceSpecificationRole.notes: An assertion that a ServiceSecification calls upon another ServiceSpecification in order to deliver its stated functionality.

CapabilityConfiguration.notes: A composite structure representing the physical and human resources (and their interactions) in an enterprise, assembled to meet a capability).

tagged_values.name: Avoiding redundancy in IT-SysBw
tagged_values.values: gegeben,nicht gegeben (bewusst),nicht gegeben (Harmonisierung geplant),keine Relevanz,not set

tagged_values.name: Client separation
tagged_values.values: Rechte- und Rollenmanagement,dedizierte virtuelle Server,dedizierte Plattenpartitionen,dedizierte virtuelle LANs,unterschiedliche Verschlüsselung in den Datenbereichen,physische Trennung,keine,keine Relevanz,not set

IT-Planning board involved

tagged_values.values: Ja (entsprechend vorgesehener Art und Weise),Ja (mit Abweichungen),Nein,keine Relevanz,not set

tagged_values.values: berücksichitigt,nicht berücksichtigt,teilweise berücksichtigt,keine verfügbar,keine Relevant,not set

tagged_values.name: Reusability of existing solutions

Function.notes: An Activity which is specified in the context to the ResourcePerformer (human or machine) that IsCapableToPerform it.

NaturalResource.notes: Type of physical resource that occurs in nature.

ResourceArchitecture.notes: A type used to denote a model of the Architecture, described from the ResourcePerformer perspective.

ResourceArtifact.notes: A type of man-made object that contains no human beings (i.e. satellite, radio, petrol, gasoline, etc.).

tagged_values.name: Scalability
tagged_values.values: scale up (vertikal),scale out (horizontal),keine Skalierung,keine Relevanz,not set

tagged_values.name: Type of scalability
tagged_values.values: keine Skalierung,Lastskalierbarkeit,räumliche Skalierung,zeitlich-räumliche Skalierung,strukturelle Skalierung,keine Relevanz,not set

ResourceInterface.notes: A declaration that specifies a contract between the ResourcePerformers it is related to and any other ResourcePerformers it can interact with. It is also intended to be an implementation of a specification of an Interface in the Business and/or Service layer.

Software.notes: A sub-type of ResourceArtifact that specifies an executable computer program.

System.notes: An integrated set of elements, subsystems, or assemblies that accomplish a defined objective. These elements include products (hardware, software, firmware), processes, people, information, techniques, facilities, services, and other support elements (INCOSE SE Handbook V4, 2015).

Protocol.notes: A Standard for communication over a network. Protocols may be composite, represented as a ProtocolStack made up of ProtocolLayers.

Protocolstack.notes: A sub type of Protocol that contains the ProtocolLayers, defining a complete stack.

Measurement.notes: A property of an element representing something in the physical world, expressed in amounts of a unit of measure.

MeasurementType.notes: A type of a property representing something in the physical world, expressed in amounts of a unit of measure.

PartOfCatalogue.notes: This relation states that a category (RequirementCategory) belongs to a requirements catalog (RequirementCatalogue).

PartOfCategory.notes: This relation states that his functional or non-functional requirement belongs to a category (RequirementCategory) of the requirements catalog.

ConformsTo.notes: A relationship that expresses that an UAFElement conforms to a standard.

RealizesRecommendation.notes: Relation states that a Recommendation is realized through this element.

RefersTo.notes: Relationship that assigns a finding to a recommendation.

ResultsFrom.notes: Relationship expresses that an element of architecture is the reason for a finding.

StakeholderConcern.notes: A relationship that expresses which concern a stakeholder has.

ConflictsWith.notes: Relation that represents a conflict between two requirements.

IsDuplicateOf.notes: Relation that represents that two requirements convey the same content.

Refines.notes: Relation that represents a refinement of a requirement by another requirement.

Replaces.notes: Relation that represents a replacement of a requirement with another requirement.

Requires.notes: Relation that represents that a requirement assumes another requirement.

StemsFrom.notes: Relationship that states that one requirement stems from another.

DerivedFrom.notes: Relation that shows that a functional or non-functional requirement is based on a process, role and task carrier, information element or other element.

Implements.notes: A tuple that defines how an element in the upper layer of abstraction is implemented by a semantically equivalent element (i.e. tracing the OperationalActivities to the Functions that implement them) in the lower level of abstraction.

ToBeRealizedBy.notes: Relation states that a functional or non-functional requirement should be realized through this element.

Classified.notes: Relationship that indicates which classification an element has.

JustifiedBy.notes: Relation states that an Constraint is derived from a reference (Reference, DocumentReference, SMEReference).

OriginatesFrom.notes: Relation that derives an element in the architectural model from a reference (Reference, DocumentReference, SMEReference).

Satisfy.notes: This relation states that an constraint affects an element.

Checks.notes: Relation that shows that an acceptance criterion (FitCriterion) is valid for a functional or non-functional requirement.

Evaluates.notes: This relation states that an evaluation criterion (FulfilmentCriterion) can be assigned to a specific acceptance criterion (FitCriterion).

RealiseRequirement.notes: Relation states that a functional or non-functional requirement is realized through this element.
